before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"3a849","text":"Make sure to assemble and keep ready all materials, equipment and reagents needed for the procedure.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kphk","text":"Check to be sure the weighing balance and Micro pipette is working correctly (are able to weigh the right mass in the right units, and picks up the right volume respectively).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aj6id","text":"DNA dyes stain deoxyribonucleic acid for laboratory purposes such as detection and quantification. Many DNA dyes also bind to RNA and could be more broadly described as nucleic acid stains. Common dyes included ethidium bromide (EtBr), especially for agarose gel electrophoresis of DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":211,"length":16},{"key":1,"offset":251,"length":27}],"data":{}},{"key":"b0jl5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"395ct","text":"DNA gel electrophoresis using agarose is a common tool in molecular biology laboratories, allowing separation of DNA fragments by size. After separation, DNA is visualized by staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmhgc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vock","text":"Thiazole orange compares favorably to common staining methods in that it is sensitive, inexpensive, excitable with UV or blue light (to prevent sample damage), and safer than ethidium bromide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a0en","text":"Thiazole orange is known to interact with DNA and produce significant fluorescence which can be used to visualize DNA in electrophoresis gels.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g3vk","text":"Thiazole orange powder can dissolve completely without precipitating in several solvents except water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"798ji","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fa5i","text":"Scope:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds6s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5esf2","text":"This protocol covers the steps involved in making a 10000x stock DNA gel stain using Thiazole orange dye powder.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlhi0","text":"This protocol also covers the steps involved in using the 10000x stock to prepare a 1.3ug/ml final concentration of gel stain required to visualize DNA bands on an agarose gel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2mm9r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20lvp","text":"The solvent used for this protocol is DMSO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C2F1EFB8931111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://openwetware.org/wiki/Ethidium_bromide"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C2F1EFF5931111ECAE1F0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://openwetware.org/wiki/Agarose_gel_electrophoresis"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bscra","text":"It is advisable to prepare the DNA gel stain in large batches(10-15 tubes) to enable easy weighing of the powder especially in situations where a high precision balance is unavailable.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing a 13mg/ml stock of DNA gel stain (1ml)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"33kd","text":"Use a weighing balance to carefully measure  of Thiazole Orange powder (Cas # 107091-89-4) into a 1.5ml Eppendorf tube or opaque screw cap tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55cad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.013","error":false,"guid":"78FBBC10C48911EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 13mg/ml stock of DNA gel stain (1ml)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c96o6","text":"Use a micropipette to pipette   of DMSO (Cas # 67-68-5) into the same Eppendorf tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":30,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"70vjd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1000","error":false,"guid":"80797590C48911EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 13mg/ml stock of DNA gel stain (1ml)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bmoca","text":"Mix by gently inverting the tube several times to have a 10000x stock. This step may take a minute or less.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"h0ql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"85BCF680C48911EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 13mg/ml stock of DNA gel stain (1ml)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"imhc","text":"For immediate or daily use, leave at room temperature away from contact with sunlight (It can be stable up to 3 months. If not immediately used, store the gel stain stock in the fridge or freeze for 6 to 12 months.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparing a 1.3ug/ml final concentration of DNA gel stain for agarose gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"40r8b","text":"Follow the step 9 in this protocol to prepare a 1X TBE buffer from a 10X stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":21,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":13}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6F369440C7A211EC90AC136B77F66048","url":"https://www.protocols.io/edit/preparing-10x-tbe-electrophoresis-buffer-b5p9q5r6"}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 1.3ug/ml final concentration of DNA gel stain for agarose gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bv9l3","text":"Prepare a 2% agarose gel by diluting 0.5g of agarose powder in 25ml 1x TBE or (calculate the corresponding amount of agarose to use for the  percentage and volume of agarose gel desired).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6vifp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"55k05","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53vbd","text":"The percentage of your gel would depend on the size of DNA template to be amplified and the volume of gel on the size of the casting tray available.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 1.3ug/ml final concentration of DNA gel stain for agarose gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"hq2g","text":"From the 10000x DNA gel stain stock, pipette into   molten agar","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":44,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3tjr0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"62C902E0C49311EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"25","error":false,"guid":"6CD4E150C49311EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

This may take about .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":60,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dr1k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"70CCEF20C49611EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1200,"guid":"83DEADB0C49611EC8ED91B7394713B38","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

steps.section: Preparing a 1.3ug/ml final concentration of DNA gel stain for agarose gel electrophoresis
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6365j","text":"Load and run the gel immediately or you can keep the gel on the bench at room temperature till you are ready ( the gel can stay up to 3 to 6 hours without affecting visualization of DNA bands).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: SOP024: Preparing 10000x DNA gel stain
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"9bula","text":"Weigh safety googles, gloves and face masks before weighing out the dye powder.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pn05","text":"Avoid the formation or emission of dust particles.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
